guide.introduction:
Sketchup Model

Additional Materials Required:

  • 1" Keyed Coupler
  • 1/4"x 2" Bolt
guide.introduction_rendered:
Sketchup Model

Additional Materials Required:

  • 1" Keyed Coupler
  • 1/4"x 2" Bolt
Relevant parts
  • Welder
  • Angle grinder
  • Drill press
  • Chalk or something to mark steel with

parts.text: Chalk or something to mark steel with

lines.text: Drill or punch the hole in the flatbar.
lines.text_raw: Drill or punch the hole in the flatbar.

lines.text: Weld the two pieces of flatbar together.
lines.text_raw: Weld the two pieces of flatbar together.

lines.text: This needs to be a really strong weld! The hammer will be under a lot of stress, and if it's not a solid weld, it could fly off! (This is why the guard is there.)
lines.text_raw: This needs to be a really strong weld! The hammer will be under a lot of stress, and if it's not a solid weld, it could fly off! (This is why the guard is there.)

lines.text: Tack the shaft into the hole so there's about a 1/4" distance between the end of the shaft and the opposite side of the hammer.
lines.text_raw: Tack the shaft into the hole so there's about a 1/4" distance between the end of the shaft and the opposite side of the hammer.

lines.text: Cut the coupler down so it's 2" long. It doesn't matter from which side you cut it.
lines.text_raw: Cut the coupler down so it's 2" long. It doesn't matter from which side you cut it.

lines.text: Get the shaker motor, the mount you made, the shaft/hammer, and the coupler.
lines.text_raw: Get the shaker motor, the mount you made, the shaft/hammer, and the coupler.

lines.text: Put the shaker motor onto the mount and couple the shaft to it. Mark where the shaft enters the coupler.
lines.text_raw: Put the shaker motor onto the mount and couple the shaft to it. Mark where the shaft enters the coupler.

lines.text: Make sure the coupler won't be rubbing on the mount while it spins.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the coupler won't be rubbing on the mount while it spins.

lines.text: Make sure the hammer has about 5/8" clearance from the mount.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the hammer has about 5/8" clearance from the mount.

lines.text: If not, you can pull it out of the coupler a little, but make sure the bolt won't be too close to the edge.
lines.text_raw: If not, you can pull it out of the coupler a little, but make sure the bolt won't be too close to the edge.

lines.text: Otherwise, you can grind away the tacks on the hammer and tack it properly.
lines.text_raw: Otherwise, you can grind away the tacks on the hammer and tack it properly.

steps.title: Drill hole for bolt in coupler

lines.text: Remove the motor and shaft from the mount.
lines.text_raw: Remove the motor and shaft from the mount.

lines.text: Put the coupler back onto the shaft.
lines.text_raw: Put the coupler back onto the shaft.

lines.text: Drill the 1/4" hole thru the coupler and rod, using the mark you made to make sure the rod is inside the coupler by the proper amount.
lines.text_raw: Drill the 1/4" hole thru the coupler and rod, using the mark you made to make sure the rod is inside the coupler by the proper amount.

lines.text: The hole should be 3/8" away from the edge of the coupler.
lines.text_raw: The hole should be 3/8" away from the edge of the coupler.

lines.text: Drill thru both at the same time. You will need some sort of vise to hold it down while you drill.
lines.text_raw: Drill thru both at the same time. You will need some sort of vise to hold it down while you drill.

lines.text: Double-check that your bolt will fit thru. If not, either re-drill it with a slightly bigger bit, or do another set of holes.
lines.text_raw: Double-check that your bolt will fit thru. If not, either re-drill it with a slightly bigger bit, or do another set of holes.

steps.title: Weld the shaft to the hammer

lines.text: Remove the coupler.
lines.text_raw: Remove the coupler.

lines.text: Fully weld the hammer to the shaft, plug-welding the back side, and welding around the shaft on the other side.
lines.text_raw: Fully weld the hammer to the shaft, plug-welding the back side, and welding around the shaft on the other side.

lines.text: Make sure this weld is SOLID.
lines.text_raw: Make sure this weld is SOLID.
